description: Argentina is a global leader in production and exports of several major agricultural products:
corn, soy, beef, and wine.  Students explore the economic and political factors that affect these
goods' internal markets and how domestic production responds to these factors and world market
conditions.  Students gain an understanding of international commodity trade, futures markets, and
the economics of agricultural production through readings, discussions, and meetings with experts
in Argentine agriculture.  Counts toward the Economics major.  Prerequisite: ECON 121 or
